author: Yaman Agarwal

ingredients.quantity: 1/2 tsp or ¼ tsp of yellow color
250 gms cut into 1 ½ - 2 inches long strips
2 tbsp add 1 tbsp butter, if your like

recipeIntros.text:
Hey Foodies,
If you have an upcoming vegetarian food function then the immediate dish that comes in mind is Paneer, but aren’t you bored repeating the same paneer dishes at every party. Today’s recipe will break the monotony; here is a recipe which is rich and royal, the all famous Yellow Hyderabadi Paneer Majestic. Paneer strips lightly coated with a smooth and silky yellow batter, deep fried until golden and then tossed in aromatic spice tadka and finally coated with the rich creamy majestic yellow color sauce. This is a recipe that gives you restaurant style flavors at home with minimal effort. Let’s savor this majestic lip smacking paneer dish along with your friends and family.

recipeNotes:
Notes:
Paneer majestic is known for its yellow colour, hence do not skip the turmeric powder or yellow food colour.
Cumin seeds and coriander is a key ingredient in making the paneer majestic.
If you do not add corn flour then the dahi will split. Adding corn flour makes the dish very creamy.
title: Paneer Majestic Recipe – Restaurant Style Hyderabadi Starter – CookingShooking

steps.text: In a large mixing bowl combine, maida, corn flour, dahi, salt, pepper and turmeric powder or yellow food color. Stir everything well.
Add little water at a time to make a smooth batter, once done set aside.
Add the paneer strip in the batter, and stir the paneer, until well coated.

In a deep frying pan, heat the oil on high flame. Fry the paneer in batches. Deep fry them for 2- 3 minutes or until they are golden in colour. Follow the same procedure for the remaining paneer. Remove on a kitchen towel. Set aside.
Heat a wok over high heat, pour oil in the wok starting from the sides.
Add cumin seeds, red chili, curry leaves and garlic. Fry for 15-20 second on high flame. Stir using a metal flat spoon.
Then add capsicum, onions and green chili cook everything for 1 minute.
Add coriander leaves, mint leaves, salt and pepper, cook for 1 minute.
Now add msg, coriander powder and chili powder, cook for 1 minute over medium flame.
Next combine dahi, yellow food colour and corn flour and give it a good mix.
Add the dahi mixture to the tadka and mix everything until well combined. Cook for 1 minute, stirring continuously.
Finally add the lemon juice and some water, which was mixed in the same dahi bowl. Stir everything.
Add the paneer strips to the sauce and ensure that all the paneer is coated well.  Paneer Majestic is ready.
Sprinkle some fresh coriander and serve the Paneer Majestic along as a starter.
